page.title: 15POPULATION IN MOUNTAIN ASH
page.content:
The population in Mountain Ash is in steady decline.This is clearly shown by the falling roles in our schools.It has become a steadily ageing population.{Since 1951 the population {has dropped by as much as 18 per cent. The number at present is only 15,418.
The closure of the Deep Duffryn Colliery in 1980 saw the end of mining in the town and the loss of even more of the population.This lack of industry in the town and the Cynon Valley as a whole has meant yonger people leaving the area in search of employment elsewhere.
Mountain Ash is now more or less a dormitory town with almost the entire working population employed somewhere else.
